name: Byfords

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second trip to Byfords and it didn't disappoint. This is a really special place to stay (their words, but true) with some really nice touches like free tea and cake on arrival, chocolates in the bedroom and fresh flowers in the room. They have some fabulous offers during the winter - we had the free dinner which was immense. Don't come here if you want to diet! The food is fabulous and the cheese selection particularly good - the advantage of owning the deli too.
reviews.title: A perfect place to get away from it all
What has happened to the cakes?!
reviews.text: Lots to do in Holt and the surrounding countryside is beautiful. Highly recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been going to Byfords for many years, and always loved the sponge cakes. But the last few occasions have been really let down. They were always so beautifully homemade and delicious, now they taste like any old cake that you can buy in the supermarket and are obviously mass produced. I appreciate that Byfords is very popular and wanted to expand, but looks like they have lost that charm that they had.
reviews.title: An interesting amalgam of smart accomodation and rustic catering

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also why no leaf tea? When you are paying nearly £3 for a pot of tea for two, I feel rather disappointed to open the pot and find a teabag, which costs pence, and does not deliver the same quality as leaf tea does.
reviews.title: Not such a wonderful Evening Meal !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights on dinner bed and breakfast terms on a cold January weekend. We had some initial misgivings about the parking here but in practice had no difficulties during our stay despite the small car park.Suspect that peak season would be a very different matter and Holt is badly in need of the much awaited new public pound. Warm reception with complimentary tea.
reviews.title: What a beautiful, relaxing place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing is too much trouble at the Higgledy piglydy world of Byfords and it’s the small touches that make a big difference in this beautiful boutique style B&B in North Norfolk. It’s a perfect base to visit the coast and North Norfolk towns and villages.
reviews.title: Perfect relaxing getaway - a little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the staff to be very warm, friendly, chatty and efficient.
reviews.title: What a gem

reviews.text: I have stayed a couple of times now, different rooms each time. The rooms are clean, cosy, welcoming and full of mod cons. The bathrooms are fabulous with a bath big enough for two, in built stereo (in the room I was in) dimmer switch lights create the perfect relaxing ambiance and complimentary bath salts, tea lights and matches! Each room is different in size and shape, take a look at the Byfords website to pick you favourite room (prices differ on different room types)
reviews.title: A great find.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Byfords really do think of everything, we had freshly made heart shaped biscuits in our room with a complimentary bottle of water. Fresh milk is provided in a fridge in the hallway for the perfect cup of tea. We arrived at about 3pm and were invited to go to the café and have a complimentary coffee and cake which was a lovely touch. I can recommend the millionaires shortbread
reviews.title: Excellent room!

reviews.text: We stayed on a dinner, bed and breakfast rate and thoroughly enjoyed our meal.
reviews.title: AWFUL

reviews.text: There are sometimes so many negative comments about Byfords but I have always loved this place. The food and ambience are lovely but what makes it is the service. The staff are so friendly and look pleased to see you. Some places if you are over a certain age no one seems to bother. We often go in with our grandchildren and they really look after you.
reviews.title: A happy friendly place,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A young girl who is assistant manager at a rival place trained at Byfords and it shows, she told us they are taught to remember small things about regulars and that really matters. She has changed things since she started and various friends have said the same.
reviews.title: Even better than the photos

reviews.text: Byfords will always remain one of our favourites for dinner my wife loves the hot chocolate in the mornings too.
reviews.title: BRILLIANT AS USUAL!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am judging this as a hotel too as my son recently stayed with his wife and we had a look round. It was stunning.
reviews.title: Home from home
Perfect B&B
reviews.text: We wanted a romantic break with a bit of luxury and picked Byfords after reading the reviews. We were not disappointed. Our room, Room 3, was even better than the photos - absolutely stunning, much bigger than it looks on the web,with a wonderful, luxurious bathroom. We loved the Arran toiletries, fresh lilies in the bathroom, home made shortbread, complimentary tea and cake on arrival (a lovely touch), and the fact that there were lots of helpful staff on hand, Not cheap, but worth the extra. We booked 2 nights DBB - warning, the portions are huge, particularly the deli boards and half chicken. We failed miserably to eat everything on our first night! The cafe seemed to be permanently busy the whole time (and this was mid-January) so I can imagine people might have to queue in the summer. While the bedroom was immaculate, we felt the front room of the cafe looked very tired and much in need of fresh paint, but this really was the only negative point we could find. We will return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful rooms- website did not do our huge and well appointed room justice. Loved the whole styling. Breakfasts were fantastic and served all morning- no 2 hr time slot to try and fit into here. Great service also from reception and loved the nice extra touches in the rooms.
reviews.title: Beautiful spot

reviews.text: Went to byfords for a coffee, I ordered a cappuccino was very good but the atmosphere was terrible, the waiters are too young and always gossiping in the corners! no good for a nice chat with friends or family! I was desapointed when I ask for bill and paid, we were leaving and we turned to the wrong way and waiter was watching us and did not said anything to us! waiters are rude and immature is like being in college interval! not good for the lovely town HOLT!
reviews.title: nice coffee thats all!!

reviews.text: We stayed for three nights and had a great time! Accommodation was fantastic, bed really comfy, staff very friendly and accommodating! Breakfasts were really good so was the evening meals which was included in our rate! Would stay again.
reviews.title: Great new years treat!!

reviews.text: Yes it has a nice warm country atmosphere but after wrestling with a jaw breaking raw chewy steak sandwich and my daughter, a truly awful watery mozzarella / tomato pizza which she could only manage half of - I think I will take a wide birth next time and head for Butlers. I wasn't looking for a refund when I highlighted the sandwich was far too chewy and rare, but never the less I would like some acknowledgement from a manager, maybe a token 10% off (£1.50) as an apology - but nothing!
reviews.title: Atmosphere clouds judgement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful B & B. Attention to detail and finishing touches are superb. The spirit and magic of Christmas begin here......that's why we return year after year.
reviews.title: Perfection

description: Holt, North Norfolk, 5 Star Gold Award Posh B&B, thriving restaurant & award-winning deli. Huge Vi Spring beds, Bang & Olufsen TV / DVD / Stereo, marble bathrooms & masses of character. 4 Miles from beach.
